Stack.name: Stack

Stack:Pop.name: Stack:Pop
Stack:Pop.description: Pop an item from the stack.

returns.description: amount Amount of items you want to pop. Defaults to 1.

Stack:Push.name: Stack:Push
Stack:Push.description: Push an item onto the stack.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The item you want to push.

Stack:Size.name: Stack:Size
Stack:Size.description: Returns the size of the stack.

returns.description: The size of the stack.

Stack:Top.name: Stack:Top
Stack:Top.description: Get the item at the top of the stack.

returns.description: The item at the top of the stack.

Stack.description:
An object returned by Stack().

Like a Lua table, a Stack is a container. It follows the principle of LIFO
(last in, first out).

The Stack works like a stack of papers: the first page you put down (push)
will be the last one you remove (pop). That also means that the last page you
put down, will be the first to be removed.

returns.description: Returns itself.

PersistentData:save.name: PersistentData:save
PersistentData:save.description: Stores data in the data file.

returns.description: Returns itself.

PersistentData.description: Used to store persistent data between different sessions and servers.

fields.description: Path of the file the data is stored in.

achievements.name: achievements

achievements.BalloonPopped.name: achievements.BalloonPopped
achievements.BalloonPopped.description:
Adds one to the count of balloons burst. Once this count reaches 1000,
the 'Popper' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.Count.name: achievements.Count
achievements.Count.description: Returns the amount of achievements in Garry's Mod.

returns.description: The amount of achievements available.

achievements.EatBall.name: achievements.EatBall
achievements.EatBall.description:
Adds one to the count of balls eaten. Once this count reaches 200,
the 'Ball Eater' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.GetCount.name: achievements.GetCount

parameters.name: achievementID
parameters.description: The ID of achievement to retrieve progress of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

returns.description: The achievement progress for the given achievementID. Note: Non-progress based achievements will have 0, even if they are completed.

examples:
Will print achievement progress for all of your achievements into
console.
```lua
for i = 0, achievements.Count() - 1 do
    print( achievements.GetCount(i) )
end
```

achievements.GetDesc.name: achievements.GetDesc

parameters.name: achievementID
parameters.description: The ID of achievement to retrieve progress of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

examples:
Will print achievement descriptions for all of your achievements
into console.
```lua
for i = 0, achievements.Count() - 1 do
    print( achievements.GetDesc(i) )
end
```

achievements.GetGoal.name: achievements.GetGoal
achievements.GetGoal.description: Retrieves progress goal of given achievement.

parameters.name: achievementID
parameters.description: The ID of achievement to retrieve progress of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

returns.description: Progress goal of an achievement.

parameters.name: achievementID
parameters.description: The ID of achievement to retrieve progress of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

returns.description: Name of an achievement.

achievements.IncBaddies.name: achievements.IncBaddies
achievements.IncBaddies.description:
Adds one to the count of baddies killed. Once this count reaches 1000,
the 'War Zone' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.IncBystander.name: achievements.IncBystander
achievements.IncBystander.description:
Adds one to the count of innocent animals killed. Once this count reaches
1000, the 'Innocent Bystander' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.IncGoodies.name: achievements.IncGoodies
achievements.IncGoodies.description:
Adds one to the count of friendly NPCs killed. Once this count reaches 1000,
the 'Bad Friend' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.IsAchieved.name: achievements.IsAchieved
achievements.IsAchieved.description:
Used in Garry's Mod 12 in the achievements menu to show the user if they have
unlocked certain achievements.

parameters.name: achievementID
parameters.description: The ID of achievement to retrieve progress of. Note: IDs start from 0, not 1.

returns.description: Returns true if the given achievementID is achieved.

achievements.Remover.name: achievements.Remover
achievements.Remover.description:
Adds one to the count of things removed. Once this count reaches 5000,
the 'Destroyer' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.SpawnedNPC.name: achievements.SpawnedNPC
achievements.SpawnedNPC.description:
Adds one to the count of NPCs spawned. Once this count reaches 1000,
the 'Procreator' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.SpawnedProp.name: achievements.SpawnedProp
achievements.SpawnedProp.description:
Adds one to the count of props spawned. Once this count reaches 5000,
the 'Creator' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.SpawnedRagdoll.name: achievements.SpawnedRagdoll
achievements.SpawnedRagdoll.description:
Adds one to the count of ragdolls spawned. Once this count reaches 2000,
the 'Dollhouse' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.SpawnMenuOpen.name: achievements.SpawnMenuOpen
achievements.SpawnMenuOpen.description:
Adds one to the count of how many times the spawnmenu has been opened.
Once this count reaches 100,000, the 'Menu User' achievement is unlocked.

achievements.description:
This library is used internally by Garry's Mod to help keep track of
achievement progress and unlock the appropriate achievements once a certain
number is reached.

cam.name: cam

cam.ApplyShake.name: cam.ApplyShake
cam.ApplyShake.description: Shakes the screen at a certain position.

cam.End2D.name: cam.End2D
cam.End2D.description: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 2D context.

cam.End3D.name: cam.End3D
cam.End3D.description: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D context.

cam.End3D2D.name: cam.End3D2D
cam.End3D2D.description: Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D2D context.

cam.EndOrthoView.name: cam.EndOrthoView
cam.EndOrthoView.description:
Switches the renderer back to the previous drawing mode from a 3D
orthographic rendering context.

cam.GetModelMatrix.name: cam.GetModelMatrix
cam.GetModelMatrix.description: Returns the currently active model matrix.

cam.IgnoreZ.name: cam.IgnoreZ
cam.IgnoreZ.description:
Tells the renderer to ignore the depth buffer and draw any upcoming
operation "ontop" of everything that was drawn yet.

parameters.name: ignoreZ
parameters.description: Determines whenever to ignore the depth buffer or not.

cam.PopModelMatrix.name: cam.PopModelMatrix
cam.PopModelMatrix.description:
Pops the current active rendering matrix from the stack and reinstates the
previous one.

cam.PushModelMatrix.name: cam.PushModelMatrix
cam.PushModelMatrix.description:
Pushes the specified matrix onto the render matrix stack. Unlike opengl,
this will replace the current model matrix.

parameters.name: multiply
parameters.description: If set, multiplies given matrix with currently active matrix (cam.GetModelMatrix) before pushing.

examples:
Rotates and scales text in the center of the screen.
```lua
hook.Add("HUDPaint", "2d rotation test", function()
    local w, h = ScrW(), ScrH()
    local t = RealTime()*50

    local mat = Matrix()

    mat:Translate(Vector(w/2, h/2))
    mat:Rotate(Angle(0,t,0))
    mat:Scale(Vector(1,1,1) * math.sin(t/100) *10)
    mat:Translate(-Vector(w/2, h/2))

    cam.PushModelMatrix(mat)
    surface.SetFont("DermaDefault")
        surface.SetTextColor(255, 255, 255, 255)
        surface.SetTextPos(w/2, h/2)
        surface.DrawText("LOLLOLOLOL")
    cam.PopModelMatrix()
end)
```

Simple function to draw rotated text.
```lua
function draw.TextRotated(text, x, y, color, font, ang)
    render.PushFilterMag(TEXFILTER.ANISOTROPIC)
    render.PushFilterMin(TEXFILTER.ANISOTROPIC)
    surface.SetFont(font)
    surface.SetTextColor(color)
    surface.SetTextPos(0, 0)
    local textWidth, textHeight = surface.GetTextSize( text )
    local rad = -math.rad( ang )
    x = x - ( math.cos( rad ) * textWidth / 2 + math.sin( rad ) * textHeight / 2 )
    y = y + ( math.sin( rad ) * textWidth / 2 + math.cos( rad ) * textHeight / 2 )
    local m = Matrix()
    m:SetAngles(Angle(0, ang, 0))
    m:SetTranslation(Vector(x, y, 0))
    cam.PushModelMatrix(m)
        surface.DrawText(text)
    cam.PopModelMatrix()
    render.PopFilterMag()
    render.PopFilterMin()
end
```

cam.Start.name: cam.Start
cam.Start.description:
Sets up a new rendering context. This is an extended version of cam.Start3D
and cam.Start2D. Must be finished by cam.End3D or cam.End2D.

cam.Start2D.name: cam.Start2D
cam.Start2D.description:
Sets up a new 2D rendering context. Must be finished by cam.End2D.

This is almost always used with a render target from the render. To set its
position use render.SetViewPort with a target already stored.

cam.Start3D.name: cam.Start3D
cam.Start3D.description:
Sets up a new 3D rendering context. Must be finished by cam.End3D.

For more advanced settings such as an orthographic view, use cam.Start
instead.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate of where to start the new view port.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of where to start the new view port.

examples:
Set up a 3D rendering environment in a 2D rendering hook to render
models on HUD.
```lua
hook.Add("HUDPaint", "3d_camera_example", function()
    cam.Start3D()
        for id, ply in ipairs(player.GetAll()) do
            ply:DrawModel()
        end
    cam.End3D()
end)
```

cam.Start3D2D.name: cam.Start3D2D
cam.Start3D2D.description:
Sets up a new 2D rendering context. Must be finished by cam.End3D2D.
This function pushes a new matrix onto the stack. (cam.PushModelMatrix)

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Origin of the 3D2D context, ie. the top left corner, (0, 0).

parameters.name: angles
parameters.description:
Angles of the 3D2D context. +x in the 2d context corresponds to +x of the angle (its forward direction). +y in the 2d context corresponds to -y of the angle (its right direction).

If (dx, dy) are your desired (+x, +y) unit vectors, the angle you want is dx:AngleEx(dx:Cross(-dy)).

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: The scale of the render context. If scale is 1 then 1 pixel in 2D context will equal to 1 unit in 3D context.

examples:
Makes a floating rectangle with text above where the player is
looking at, pointing at the player
```lua
hook.Add("PostDrawOpaqueRenderables", "example", function()
    -- Get the game's camera angles
    local angle = EyeAngles()

    -- Only use the Yaw component of the angle
    angle = Angle( 0, angle.y, 0 )

    -- Apply some animation to the angle
    angle.y = angle.y + math.sin( CurTime() ) * 10

    -- Correct the angle so it points at the camera
    -- This is usually done by trial and error using Up(), Right() and Forward() axes
    angle:RotateAroundAxis( angle:Up(), -90 )
    angle:RotateAroundAxis( angle:Forward(), 90 )

    -- A trace just for a position
    local trace = LocalPlayer():GetEyeTrace()
    local pos = trace.HitPos

    -- Raise the hitpos off the ground by 20 units and apply some animation
    pos = pos + Vector( 0, 0, math.cos( CurTime() / 2 ) + 20 )

    -- Notice the scale is small, so text looks crispier
    cam.Start3D2D( pos, angle, 0.1 )--
        -- Get the size of the text we are about to draw
        local text = "Testing"
        surface.SetFont( "Default" )
        local tW, tH = surface.GetTextSize( "Testing" )

        -- This defines amount of padding for the box around the text
        local pad = 5

        -- Draw a rectable. This has to be done before drawing the text, to prevent overlapping
        -- Notice how we start drawing in negative coordinates
        -- This is to make sure the 3d2d display rotates around our position by its center, not left corner
        surface.SetDrawColor( 0, 0, 0, 255 )
        surface.DrawRect(-tW / 2 - pad, -pad, tW + pad * 2, tH + pad * 2)

        -- Draw some text
        draw.SimpleText("Testing", "Default", -tW / 2, 0, color_white)
    cam.End3D2D()
end)
```

cam.StartOrthoView.name: cam.StartOrthoView
cam.StartOrthoView.description: Sets up a new 3d context using orthographic projection.

cam.description:
This directs all drawing to be done to a certain 2D or 3D plane or position,
until the corresponding "End" function is called.
The matrix functions exist, but are mostly unusable unless you're familiar
with the source engine's layout for each aspect.

player.name: player

Gets all the current players in the server (not including connecting
clients).

returns.description: All Players currently in the server.

player.GetBots.name: player.GetBots
player.GetBots.description: Returns a table of all bots on the server.

returns.description: A table only containing bots ( AI / non human players )

player.GetByAccountID.name: player.GetByAccountID
player.GetByAccountID.description: Gets the player with the specified AccountID.

parameters.name: accountID
parameters.description: The Player:AccountID to find the player by.

returns.description: Player if one is found, false otherwise

player.GetByID.name: player.GetByID
player.GetByID.description:
Gets the player with the specified connection ID.

Connection ID can be retrieved via gameevent.Listen events.

For a function that returns a player based on their Entity:EntIndex, see
Entity.

For a function that returns a player based on their Player:UserID, see
Player.

parameters.name: connectionID
parameters.description: The connection ID to find the player by.

returns.description: Player if one is found, nil otherwise.

player.GetBySteamID.name: player.GetBySteamID
player.GetBySteamID.description: Gets the player with the specified SteamID.

parameters.name: steamID
parameters.description: The Player:SteamID to find the player by.

returns.description: Player if one is found, false otherwise.

player.GetBySteamID64.name: player.GetBySteamID64
player.GetBySteamID64.description: Gets the player with the specified SteamID64.

parameters.name: steamID64
parameters.description: The Player:SteamID64 to find the player by.

returns.description: Player if one is found, false otherwise.

player.GetByUniqueID.name: player.GetByUniqueID
player.GetByUniqueID.description:
Gets the player with the specified uniqueID (not recommended way to identify
players).

parameters.name: uniqueID
parameters.description: The Player:UniqueID to find the player by.

returns.description: Player if one is found, false otherwise.

player.GetCount.name: player.GetCount
player.GetCount.description:
Gives you the player count. Similar to #player.GetAll but with much better
performance.

returns.description: Number of players.

player.GetHumans.name: player.GetHumans
player.GetHumans.description:
Returns a table of all human ( non bot/AI ) players.

Unlike player.GetAll, this does not include bots.

returns.description: A table of all human ( non bot/AI ) players.

player.description:
The player library is used to get the Lua objects that represent players
in-game.

resource.name: resource

resource.AddFile.name: resource.AddFile
resource.AddFile.description:
Adds the specified and all related files to the files the client should
download.

For convenience, this function will automatically add any other files that
are related to the selected one, and throw an error if it can't find them.
For example, a .vmt file will automatically add the .vtf with the same name,
and a .mdl file will automatically add all .vvd, .ani, .dx80.vtx, .dx90.vtx,
.sw.vtx, .phy and .jpg files with the same name, with a separate error for
each missing file.

If you do not want it to do this, use resource.AddSingleFile.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Virtual path of the file to be added, relative to garrysmod/. Do not add .bz2 to the filepath. Do not put gamemodes/*gamemodename*/content/ or addons/<*addonname*/ into the path.

resource.AddSingleFile.name: resource.AddSingleFile
resource.AddSingleFile.description:
Adds the specified file to the files the client should download.

If you wish to add textures or models, consider using resource.AddFile to
add all the files required for a texture/model.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path of the file to be added, relative to garrysmod/

resource.AddWorkshop.name: resource.AddWorkshop
resource.AddWorkshop.description:
Adds a workshop addon for the client to download before entering the server.

Having the raw files from a workshop item does not count as having already
downloaded it.
So players who previously downloaded a map through Fast Download will have
to re-download it if you use the workshop.

You should try to only add addons that have custom content ( models, sounds,
etc ).

Gamemodes that are workshop enabled are automatically added to this list -
so there's no need to add them.

The server's current map is also automatically added, if it is loaded from a
workshop addon.

parameters.name: workshopid
parameters.description: The workshop id of the file. This cannot be a collection.

resource.description:
The resource library is used to control what files are sent to clients who
join a server, this includes models, materials, sounds, text files but not
Lua files.

GM.name: GM

parameters.name: text

returns.description: Return true to suppress the chat message.

For a more general purpose function that handles all kinds of input,
see GM:PlayerButtonDown.

parameters.description: The player pressing the key. If running client-side, this will always be LocalPlayer.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that the player pressed using Enums/IN.

PlayerAuthed.name: PlayerAuthed
PlayerAuthed.description: Called once when the player is authenticated.

GM.description: A list of hooks available in player classes.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text that is being sent.

returns.description: Return true to suppress the chat message.

KeyPress.name: KeyPress
KeyPress.description:
Called whenever a player pressed a key included within the IN keys.

For a more general purpose function that handles all kinds of input,
see GM:PlayerButtonDown.

parameters.name: ply
parameters.description: The player pressing the key. If running client-side, this will always be LocalPlayer.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key that the player pressed using Enums/IN.

PlayerAuthed.name: PlayerAuthed

PANEL:GetBackgroundColor.name: PANEL:GetBackgroundColor
PANEL:GetBackgroundColor.description:
Returns the background color. If this panels has a transparent background,
invoke this on the parent and return its value.

If no background color is found, the default color is returned.

returns.description: The background color.

PANEL:SetBackgroundColor.name: PANEL:SetBackgroundColor
PANEL:SetBackgroundColor.description:
Sets the background color.

If set to nil, then the panel is considered transparent.

DColorCombo.name: DColorCombo

DColorCombo:BuildControls.name: DColorCombo:BuildControls
DColorCombo:BuildControls.description: Called internally to create panels necessary for this panel to work.

DColorCombo:GetColor.name: DColorCombo:GetColor
DColorCombo:GetColor.description: Returns the color of the DColorCombo.

returns.description: The selected color.

DColorCombo:IsEditing.name: DColorCombo:IsEditing
DColorCombo:IsEditing.description:
Returns true if the panel is currently being edited.

More of a internal method, it technically should only ever work (i.e.
return true) inside DColorCombo:OnValueChanged.

returns.description: True if the panel is currently being edited.

DColorCombo:OnValueChanged.name: DColorCombo:OnValueChanged
DColorCombo:OnValueChanged.description: Called when the value (color) of this panel was changed.

DColorCombo:SetColor.name: DColorCombo:SetColor
DColorCombo:SetColor.description: Sets the color of this panel.

DColorCombo.description:
The DColorCombo allows the user to choose color, without alpha, using
DColorMixer or DColorPalette in a tabbed view.

fields.description: Middle mouse button, aka the wheel press
Mouse 4 button ( Sometimes, mouse wheel tilt left )
Mouse 5 button ( Sometimes, mouse wheel tilt right )

Color.name: Color
Color.description: Table created by the Color function and used in various situations.

AmmoData.name: AmmoData
AmmoData.description: Table structure that describes a Source Engine ammo type.

fields.description: Maximum amount of ammo of this type the player should be able to carry in reserve.
Flags for the ammo type using Enums/AMMO.
